page.title: 02CAMPTON VILLAGE
page.content: In Campton there is a shop and post office, a pub, a village hall, a village school and a church. There used to be two pubs in Campton but one closed a couple of years ago and now only The White Hart is left. There is little industry in Campton but there is some market gardening.There is a small jewelry making business and a light aircraft busines. There is also a factory which makes clay pigeons. The Village Hall is one of the main points of the village. It's single Bedfordshire brick walls are crumbling with age. The reed thatched roof was top trimmed and revived in 1975 and in 1980 an extension and new toilets were built. The River Hit runs all the way through Campton.
